mysqloption.name: group_replication_group_name
mysqloption.description: The name of the group.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_start_on_boot
mysqloption.description: Whether the server should start Group Replication or not during server start.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_local_address
mysqloption.description: The local address in host:port formatted string.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_group_seeds
mysqloption.description: A list of peer addresses, comma separated list such as host1:port1,host2:port2.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_force_members
mysqloption.description: A comma separated list of peer addresses, such as host1:port1,host2:port2.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_bootstrap_group
mysqloption.description: Configure this server to bootstrap the group.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_poll_spin_loops
mysqloption.description: The number of times the group communication thread waits

mysqloption.name: group_replication_recovery_retry_count
mysqloption.description: The number of times that a joining member tries to connect to the available donors before giving up.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_recovery_reconnect_interval
mysqloption.description: The sleep time, in seconds, between reconnection attempts when no donor was found in the group.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_recovery_use_ssl
mysqloption.description: Whether Group Replication recovery connection should use SSL or not.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_ca
mysqloption.description: The path to a file that contains a list of trusted SSL certificate authorities.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_capath
mysqloption.description: The path to a directory that contains trusted SSL certificate authority certificates.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_cert
mysqloption.description: The name of the SSL certificate file to use for establishing a secure connection.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_key
mysqloption.description: The name of the SSL key file to use for establishing a secure connection.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_crl
mysqloption.description: The path to a directory that contains files containing certificate revocation lists.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_crlpath
mysqloption.description: The path to a directory that contains files containing certificate revocation lists.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_verify_server_cert
mysqloption.description: Make the recovery process check the server's Common Name value in the donor sent certificate.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_recovery_complete_at
mysqloption.description: Recovery policies when handling cached transactions after state transfer. This option specifies whether a member is marked online after it has received all transactions that it missed before it joined the group (TRANSACTIONS_CERTIFIED) or after it has received and applied them (TRANSACTIONS_APPLIED).

mysqloption.name: group_replication_components_stop_timeout
mysqloption.description: Timeout, in seconds, that the plugin waits for each of the components when shutting down.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_allow_local_lower_version_join
mysqloption.description: Allow the current server to join the group even if it has a lower plugin version than the group.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_allow_local_disjoint_gtids_join
mysqloption.description: Allow the current server to join the group even if it has transactions not present in the group.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_auto_increment_increment
mysqloption.description: Determines the interval between successive column values for transactions that execute on this server.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_compression_threshold
mysqloption.description: The value in bytes above which (LZ4) compression is enforced. When set to zero, deactivates compression.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_gtid_assignment_block_size
mysqloption.description: The number of consecutive GTIDs that are reserved for each member. Each member consumes its blocks and reserve more when needed.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_ssl_mode
mysqloption.description: Specifies the security state of the connection between Group Replication members.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_single_primary_mode
mysqloption.description: Instructs the group to use a single server for the read/write workload.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_enforce_update_everywhere_checks
mysqloption.description: Enable or disable strict consistency checks for multi-master update everywhere.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_flow_control_mode
mysqloption.description: Specifies the mode used for flow control.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_flow_control_certifier_threshold
mysqloption.description: Specifies the number of waiting transactions in the certifier queue that trigger flow control.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_flow_control_applier_threshold
mysqloption.description: Specifies the number of waiting transactions in the applier queue that trigger flow control.

mysqloption.name: group_replication_recovery_ip_whitelist
mysqloption.description: The list of hosts permitted to connect to the group.

mysqloption.description: Whether to run in initialization mode (insecure)

mysqloption.description: Enable InnoDB (if this version of MySQL supports it)

mysqloption.description: Truncates the binary log after last nonrolled-back transaction after InnoDB crash recovery

mysqloption.description: Enable SHOW ENGINE INNODB STATUS output in the innodb_status.[pid] file

mysqloption.description: Enable or disable InnoDB adaptive hash indexes

mysqloption.name: innodb_adaptive_hash_index_parts
mysqloption.description: Partitions the adaptive hash index search system into n partitions, with each partition protected by a separate latch. Each index is bound to a specific partition based on space ID and index ID attributes.

mysqloption.name: innodb_adaptive_max_sleep_delay
mysqloption.description: Allows InnoDB to automatically adjust the value of innodb_thread_sleep_delay up or down according to the current workload

mysqloption.name: innodb_api_bk_commit_interval
mysqloption.description: How often to auto-commit idle connections that use the InnoDB memcached interface, in seconds.

mysqloption.name: innodb_api_enable_binlog
mysqloption.description: Lets you use the InnoDB memcached plugin with the MySQL binary log

mysqloption.name: innodb_api_enable_mdl
mysqloption.description: Locks the table used by the InnoDB memcached plugin, so that it cannot be dropped or altered by DDL through the SQL interface

mysqloption.name: innodb_api_trx_level
mysqloption.description: Lets you control the transaction isolation level on queries processed by the memcached interface

mysqloption.name: innodb_autoextend_increment
mysqloption.description: Data file autoextend increment in megabytes

mysqloption.name: innodb_autoinc_lock_mode
mysqloption.description: Set InnoDB auto-increment lock mode

mysqloption.description: Display total number of InnoDB rollback segments; different from innodb_undo_logs, which displays the number of active rollback segments

mysqloption.name: innodb_background_drop_list_empty
mysqloption.description: This debug option delays table creation until the background drop list is empty.

mysqloption.name: innodb_buffer_pool_awe_mem_mb
mysqloption.description: If Windows AWE is used, size in Megabytes of InnoDB buffer pool allocated from the AWE memory

mysqloption.description: Number of bytes containing data (dirty or clean) in the buffer pool

mysqloption.description: Number of bytes currently dirty in the buffer pool

mysqloption.name: innodb_buffer_pool_chunk_size
mysqloption.description: Defines the chunk size that is used when resizing the buffer pool

mysqloption.name: innodb_buffer_pool_debug
mysqloption.description: Permits multiple buffer pool instances when the buffer pool is less than 1GB in size

mysqloption.name: innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown
mysqloption.description: Specifies whether to record the pages cached in the InnoDB buffer pool when the MySQL server is shut down, to shorten the warmup process at the next restart

mysqloption.description: Immediately records the pages cached in the InnoDB buffer pool

mysqloption.name: innodb_buffer_pool_dump_pct
mysqloption.description: Specifies the percentage of the most recently used pages for each buffer pool to read out and dump.

mysqloption.name: Innodb_buffer_pool_dump_status
mysqloption.description: Display status of buffer pool recording operation triggered by innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown or innodb_buffer_pool_dump_now

mysqloption.name: innodb_buffer_pool_filename
mysqloption.description: Specifies the file that holds the list of page numbers produced by innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown or innodb_buffer_pool_dump_now

mysqloption.name: innodb_buffer_pool_instances
mysqloption.description: Specifies how many parts the InnoDB buffer pool is divided into

mysqloption.description: Interrupts process of restoring InnoDB buffer pool contents triggered by innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup or innodb_buffer_pool_load_now

mysqloption.name: innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup
mysqloption.description: Specifies that, on MySQL server startup, the InnoDB buffer pool is automatically "warmed up" by loading the same pages it held at an earlier time

mysqloption.name: innodb_buffer_pool_load_now
mysqloption.description: Immediately "warms up" the InnoDB buffer pool by loading a set of data pages, without waiting for a server restart

mysqloption.name: Innodb_buffer_pool_load_status
mysqloption.description: Display status of buffer pool warmup operation triggered by innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup or innodb_buffer_pool_load_now

mysqloption.name: Innodb_buffer_pool_pages_data
mysqloption.description: Number of pages containing data (dirty or clean) in the buffer pool

mysqloption.description: Number of pages currently dirty in the buffer pool

mysqloption.description: Number of buffer pool pages free

mysqloption.description: The status of the dynamic buffer pool resizing operation.

mysqloption.description: Size of the memory buffer InnoDB uses to cache data and indexes of its tables

mysqloption.description: Number of writes done to the buffer pool

mysqloption.description: Maximum size for the InnoDB change buffer, as a percentage of the total size of buffer pool

mysqloption.description: Whether InnoDB performs insert buffering.

mysqloption.description: Specifies how to generate and verify the checksum stored in each disk block of each InnoDB tablespace

mysqloption.description: Enables per-index compression-related statistics in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.INNODB_CMP_PER_INDEX table

mysqloption.description: Number of milliseconds between checks of cluster SQL nodes made by the MySQL query cache

mysqloption.name: ndb_clear_apply_status
mysqloption.description: Causes RESET SLAVE to clear all rows from the ndb_apply_status table. ON by default.

mysqloption.name: Ndb_cluster_node_id
mysqloption.description: If the server is acting as a MySQL Cluster node, then the value of this variable its node ID in the cluster

mysqloption.name: Ndb_config_from_host
mysqloption.description: The host name or IP address of the Cluster management server. Formerly Ndb_connected_host

mysqloption.name: Ndb_config_from_port
mysqloption.description: The port for connecting to Cluster management server. Formerly Ndb_connected_port

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_fn_epoch
mysqloption.description: Number of rows that have been found in conflict by the NDB$EPOCH() conflict detection function

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_fn_epoch2
mysqloption.description: Number of rows that have been found in conflict by the NDB$EPOCH2() conflict detection function

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_fn_epoch2_trans
mysqloption.description: Number of rows that have been found in conflict by the NDB$EPOCH2_TRANS() conflict detection function

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_fn_epoch_trans
mysqloption.description: Number of rows that have been found in conflict by the NDB$EPOCH_TRANS() conflict detection function

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_fn_max
mysqloption.description: If the server is part of a MySQL Cluster involved in cluster replication, the value of this variable indicates the number of times that conflict resolution based on "greater timestamp wins" has been applied

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_fn_max_del_win
mysqloption.description: Number of times that conflict resolution based on outcome of NDB$MAX_DELETE_WIN() has been applied.

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_fn_old
mysqloption.description: If the server is part of a MySQL Cluster involved in cluster replication, the value of this variable indicates the number of times that "same timestamp wins" conflict resolution has been applied

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_last_conflict_epoch
mysqloption.description: Most recent NDB epoch on this slave in which a conflict was detected.

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_last_stable_epoch
mysqloption.description: Number of rows found to be in conflict by a transactional conflict function

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_reflected_op_discard_count
mysqloption.description: Number of reflected operations that were not applied due an error during execution.

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_reflected_op_prepare_count
mysqloption.description: Number of reflected operations received that have been prepared for execution.

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_refresh_op_count
mysqloption.description: Number of refresh operations that have been prepared.

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_trans_conflict_commit_count
mysqloption.description: Number of epoch transactions committed after requiring transactional conflict handling.

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_trans_detect_iter_count
mysqloption.description: Number of internal iterations required to commit an epoch transaction. Should be (slightly) greater than or equal to Ndb_conflict_trans_conflict_commit_count.

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_trans_reject_count
mysqloption.description: Number of transactions rejected after being found in conflict by a transactional conflict function.

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_trans_row_conflict_count
mysqloption.description: Number of rows found in conflict by a transactional conflict function. Includes any rows included in or dependent on conflicting transactions.

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_trans_row_reject_count
mysqloption.description: Total number of rows realigned after being found in conflict by a transactional conflict function. Includes Ndb_conflict_trans_row_conflict_count and any rows included in or dependent on conflicting transactions.

mysqloption.name: ndb_data_node_neighbour
mysqloption.description: Specifies cluster data node "closest" to this MySQL Server, for transaction hinting and fully replicated tables

mysqloption.name: ndb_default_column_format
mysqloption.description: Sets default row format and column format (FIXED or DYNAMIC) used for new NDB tables.

mysqloption.name: ndb_deferred_constraints
mysqloption.description: Specifies that constraint checks should be deferred (where these are supported). Not normally needed or used; for testing purposes only.

mysqloption.name: ndb_distribution
mysqloption.description: Default distribution for new tables in NDBCLUSTER (KEYHASH or LINHASH, default is KEYHASH)

mysqloption.name: Ndb_conflict_delete_delete_count
mysqloption.description: Number of delete-delete conflicts detected (delete operation is applied, but row does not exist)

mysqloption.name: ndb_eventbuffer_free_percent
mysqloption.description: Percentage of free memory that should be available in event buffer before resumption of buffering, after reaching limit set by ndb_eventbuffer_max_alloc.

mysqloption.name: ndb_eventbuffer_max_alloc
mysqloption.description: Maximum memory that can be allocated for buffering events by the NDB API. Defaults to 0 (no limit).

mysqloption.name: Ndb_execute_count
mysqloption.description: Provides the number of round trips to the NDB kernel made by operations

mysqloption.name: ndb_extra_logging
mysqloption.description: Controls logging of MySQL Cluster schema, connection, and data distribution events in the MySQL error log

mysqloption.name: ndb_force_send
mysqloption.description: Forces sending of buffers to NDB immediately, without waiting for other threads

mysqloption.name: ndb_fully_replicated
mysqloption.description: Whether new NDB tables are fully replicated

mysqloption.name: ndb_index_stat_cache_entries
mysqloption.description: Sets the granularity of the statistics by determining the number of starting and ending keys

mysqloption.name: ndb_index_stat_enable
mysqloption.description: Use NDB index statistics in query optimization

mysqloption.name: ndb_index_stat_option
mysqloption.description: Comma-separated list of tunable options for NDB index statistics; the list should contain no spaces

mysqloption.name: ndb_index_stat_update_freq
mysqloption.description: How often to query data nodes instead of the statistics cache

mysqloption.name: ndb_join_pushdown
mysqloption.description: Enables pushing down of joins to data nodes

mysqloption.name: Ndb_last_commit_epoch_server
mysqloption.description: Epoch most recently committed by NDB.

mysqloption.name: Ndb_last_commit_epoch_session
mysqloption.description: Epoch most recently committed by this NDB client.

mysqloption.name: ndb_log_apply_status
mysqloption.description: Whether or not a MySQL server acting as a slave logs mysql.ndb_apply_status updates received from its immediate master in its own binary log, using its own server ID.

mysqloption.name: ndb_log_bin
mysqloption.description: Write updates to NDB tables in the binary log. Effective only if binary logging is enabled with --log-bin.

mysqloption.name: ndb_log_binlog_index
mysqloption.description: Insert mapping between epochs and binary log positions into the ndb_binlog_index table. Defaults to ON. Effective only if binary logging is enabled on the server.

mysqloption.name: ndb_log_empty_epochs
mysqloption.description: When enabled, epochs in which there were no changes are written to the ndb_apply_status and ndb_binlog_index tables, even when log_slave_updates is enabled.

mysqloption.name: ndb_log_empty_update
mysqloption.description: When enabled, updates which produce no changes are written to the ndb_apply_status and ndb_binlog_index tables, even when log_slave_updates is enabled.

mysqloption.name: ndb_log_exclusive_reads
mysqloption.description: Log primary key reads with exclusive locks; allow conflict resolution based on read conflicts.

mysqloption.name: ndb_log_orig
mysqloption.description: Whether the id and epoch of the originating server are recorded in the mysql.ndb_binlog_index table. Set using the --ndb-log-orig option when starting mysqld.

mysqloption.name: ndb_log_transaction_id
mysqloption.description: Whether NDB transaction IDs are written into the binary log. (Read-only.)

mysqloption.name: ndb_log_updated_only
mysqloption.description: Log complete rows (ON) or updates only (OFF)

mysqloption.name: Ndb_number_of_data_nodes
mysqloption.description: If the server is part of a MySQL Cluster, the value of this variable is the number of data nodes in the cluster

mysqloption.name: ndb_optimization_delay
mysqloption.description: Sets the number of milliseconds to wait between processing sets of rows by OPTIMIZE TABLE on NDB tables.

mysqloption.name: ndb_optimized_node_selection
mysqloption.description: Determines how an SQL node chooses a cluster data node to use as transaction coordinator

mysqloption.name: Ndb_pruned_scan_count
mysqloption.description: Number of scans executed by NDB since the cluster was last started where partition pruning could be used

mysqloption.name: Ndb_pushed_queries_defined
mysqloption.description: Number of joins that API nodes have attempted to push down to the data nodes

mysqloption.name: Ndb_pushed_queries_dropped
mysqloption.description: Number of joins that API nodes have tried to push down, but failed

mysqloption.name: Ndb_pushed_queries_executed
mysqloption.description: Number of joins successfully pushed down and executed on the data nodes

mysqloption.name: Ndb_pushed_reads
mysqloption.description: Number of reads executed on the data nodes by pushed-down joins

mysqloption.name: ndb_read_backup
mysqloption.description: Enable read from any replica

mysqloption.name: ndb_recv_thread_activation_threshold
mysqloption.description: Activation threshold when receive thread takes over the polling of the cluster connection (measured in concurrently active threads)

mysqloption.name: ndb_recv_thread_cpu_mask
mysqloption.description: CPU mask for locking receiver threads to specific CPUs; specified as hexadecimal. See documentation for details.

mysqloption.name: ndb_report_thresh_binlog_epoch_slip
mysqloption.description: NDB 7.5.4 and later: Threshold for number of epochs completely buffered, but not yet consumed by binlog injector thread which when exceeded generates BUFFERED_EPOCHS_OVER_THRESHOLD event buffer status message; prior to NDB 7.5.4: Threshold for number of epochs to lag behind before reporting binary log status

mysqloption.name: ndb_report_thresh_binlog_mem_usage
mysqloption.description: This is a threshold on the percentage of free memory remaining before reporting binary log status

mysqloption.name: Ndb_scan_count
mysqloption.description: The total number of scans executed by NDB since the cluster was last started

mysqloption.name: ndb_show_foreign_key_mock_tables
mysqloption.description: Show the mock tables used to support foreign_key_checks=0.

mysqloption.name: ndb_slave_conflict_role
mysqloption.description: Role for slave to play in conflict detection and resolution. Value is one of PRIMARY, SECONDARY, PASS, or NONE (default). Can be changed only when slave SQL thread is stopped. See documentation for further information.

mysqloption.name: Ndb_slave_max_replicated_epoch
mysqloption.description: The most recently committed NDB epoch on this slave. When this value is greater than or equal to Ndb_conflict_last_conflict_epoch, no conflicts have yet been detected.

mysqloption.name: ndb_table_no_logging
mysqloption.description: NDB tables created when this setting is enabled are not checkpointed to disk (although table schema files are created). The setting in effect when the table is created with or altered to use NDBCLUSTER persists for the lifetime of the table.

mysqloption.name: ndb_table_temporary
mysqloption.description: NDB tables are not persistent on disk: no schema files are created and the tables are not logged

mysqloption.name: ndb_use_copying_alter_table
mysqloption.description: Use copying ALTER TABLE operations in MySQL Cluster

mysqloption.name: ndb_use_exact_count
mysqloption.description: Use exact row count when planning queries

mysqloption.name: ndb_use_transactions
mysqloption.description: Forces NDB to use a count of records during SELECT COUNT(*) query planning to speed up this type of query

mysqloption.name: ndb_version
mysqloption.description: Shows build and NDB engine version as an integer.

mysqloption.name: ndb_version_string
mysqloption.description: Shows build information including NDB engine version in ndb-x.y.z format.

mysqloption.name: ndbcluster
mysqloption.description: Enable NDB Cluster (if this version of MySQL supports it)

mysqloption.name: ndbinfo_database
mysqloption.description: The name used for the NDB information database; read only.

mysqloption.name: ndbinfo_max_bytes
mysqloption.description: Used for debugging only.

mysqloption.name: ndbinfo_max_rows
mysqloption.description: Used for debugging only.

mysqloption.description: Whether to show ndbinfo internal base tables in the mysql client. The default is OFF.

mysqloption.name: ndbinfo_version

mysqloption.name: slave-checkpoint-group
mysqloption.description: Maximum number of transactions processed by a multi-threaded slave before a checkpoint operation is called to update progress status. Not supported by MySQL Cluster.

mysqloption.name: slave-checkpoint-period
mysqloption.description: Update progress status of multi-threaded slave and flush relay log info to disk after this number of milliseconds. Not supported by MySQL Cluster.

mysqloption.name: slave-load-tmpdir
mysqloption.description: The location where the slave should put its temporary files when replicating a LOAD DATA INFILE statement

mysqloption.name: slave-max-allowed-packet
mysqloption.description: Maximum size, in bytes, of a packet that can be sent from a replication master to a slave; overrides max_allowed_packet.

mysqloption.name: slave_net_timeout
mysqloption.description: Number of seconds to wait for more data from a master/slave connection before aborting the read

mysqloption.name: slave-parallel-type
mysqloption.description: Tells the slave to use database partioning (DATABASE) or timestamp information (LOGICAL_CLOCK) from the master to parallelize transactions. The default is DATABASE.

mysqloption.name: slave-parallel-workers
mysqloption.description: Number of worker threads for executing events in parallel. Set to 0 (the default) to disable slave multi-threading. Not supported by MySQL Cluster.

mysqloption.name: slave-pending-jobs-size-max
mysqloption.description: Maximum size of slave worker queues holding events not yet applied.

mysqloption.name: slave-rows-search-algorithms
mysqloption.description: Determines search algorithms used for slave update batching. Any 2 or 3 from the list INDEX_SEARCH, TABLE_SCAN, HASH_SCAN; the default is TABLE_SCAN,INDEX_SCAN.

mysqloption.name: slave-skip-errors
mysqloption.description: Tells the slave thread to continue replication when a query returns an error from the provided list

mysqloption.name: slave-sql-verify-checksum
mysqloption.description: Cause slave to examine checksums when reading from the relay log

mysqloption.name: slave_allow_batching
mysqloption.description: Turns update batching on and off for a replication slave

mysqloption.name: slave_checkpoint_group
mysqloption.description: Maximum number of transactions processed by a multi-threaded slave before a checkpoint operation is called to update progress status. Not supported by MySQL Cluster.

mysqloption.name: slave_checkpoint_period
mysqloption.description: Update progress status of multi-threaded slave and flush relay log info to disk after this number of milliseconds. Not supported by MySQL Cluster.

mysqloption.name: slave_compressed_protocol
mysqloption.description: Use compression on master/slave protocol

mysqloption.name: slave_exec_mode
mysqloption.description: Allows for switching the slave thread between IDEMPOTENT mode (key and some other errors suppressed) and STRICT mode; STRICT mode is the default, except for MySQL Cluster, where IDEMPOTENT is always used

mysqloption.name: Slave_heartbeat_period
mysqloption.description: The slave's replication heartbeat interval, in seconds

mysqloption.name: Slave_last_heartbeat
mysqloption.description: Shows when the latest heartbeat signal was received, in TIMESTAMP format.

mysqloption.name: slave_max_allowed_packet
mysqloption.description: Maximum size, in bytes, of a packet that can be sent from a replication master to a slave; overrides max_allowed_packet.

mysqloption.name: Slave_open_temp_tables
mysqloption.description: Number of temporary tables that the slave SQL thread currently has open

mysqloption.name: slave_parallel_type
mysqloption.description: Tells the slave to use database partioning (DATABASE) or information (LOGICAL_CLOCK) from master to parallelize transactions. The default is DATABASE.

mysqloption.name: slave_parallel_workers
mysqloption.description: Number of worker threads for executing events in parallel. Set to 0 (the default) to disable slave multi-threading. Not supported by MySQL Cluster.

mysqloption.name: slave_pending_jobs_size_max
mysqloption.description: Maximum size of slave worker queues holding events not yet applied.

mysqloption.name: slave_preserve_commit_order
mysqloption.description: Ensures that all commits by slave workers happen in the same order as on the master to maintain consistency when using parallel worker threads.

mysqloption.name: Slave_received_heartbeats
mysqloption.description: Number of heartbeats received by a replication slave since previous reset

mysqloption.name: Slave_retried_transactions
mysqloption.description: The total number of times since startup that the replication slave SQL thread has retried transactions

mysqloption.name: slave_rows_search_algorithms
mysqloption.description: Determines search algorithms used for slave update batching. Any 2 or 3 from the list INDEX_SEARCH, TABLE_SCAN, HASH_SCAN; the default is TABLE_SCAN,INDEX_SCAN.

mysqloption.name: Slave_running
mysqloption.description: The state of this server as a replication slave (slave I/O thread status)

mysqloption.name: slave_sql_verify_checksum
mysqloption.description: Cause slave to examine checksums when reading from relay log.

mysqloption.name: slave_transaction_retries
mysqloption.description: Number of times the slave SQL thread will retry a transaction in case it failed with a deadlock or elapsed lock wait timeout, before giving up and stopping

mysqloption.name: slave_type_conversions
mysqloption.description: Controls type conversion mode on replication slave. Value is a list of zero or more elements from the list: ALL_LOSSY, ALL_NON_LOSSY. Set to an empty string to disallow type conversions between master and slave.

mysqloption.name: slow-query-log
mysqloption.description: Enable|disable slow query log

mysqloption.name: slow-start-timeout
mysqloption.description: Wait before trying to kill windows service at startup

mysqloption.name: Slow_launch_threads
mysqloption.description: Number of threads that have taken more than slow_launch_time seconds to create

mysqloption.name: slow_launch_time
mysqloption.description: If creating the thread takes longer than this value (in seconds), the Slow_launch_threads counter will be incremented

mysqloption.name: Slow_queries
mysqloption.description: Number of queries that have taken more than long_query_time seconds

mysqloption.name: slow_query_log_file
mysqloption.description: Name of the slow query log file

mysqloption.name: socket
mysqloption.description: Socket file on which to listen for Unix socket connections

mysqloption.name: sort_buffer_size
mysqloption.description: Each thread that needs to do a sort allocates a buffer of this size

mysqloption.name: Sort_merge_passes
mysqloption.description: Number of merge passes that the sort algorithm has had to do

mysqloption.name: Sort_range
mysqloption.description: Number of sorts that were done using ranges

mysqloption.name: Sort_rows
mysqloption.description: Number of sorted rows

mysqloption.name: Sort_scan
mysqloption.description: Number of sorts that were done by scanning the table

mysqloption.name: sporadic-binlog-dump-fail
mysqloption.description: Option used by mysql-test for debugging and testing of replication

mysqloption.name: sql-bin-update-same
mysqloption.description: The update log is deprecated since version 5.0, is replaced by the binary log and this option does nothing anymore

mysqloption.name: sql-mode
mysqloption.description: Set the SQL server mode

value.default: ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY STRICT_TRANS_TABLES NO_ZERO_IN_DATE NO_ZERO_DATE ERROR_FOR_DIVISION_BY_ZERO NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION
ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY STRICT_TRANS_TABLES NO_ZERO_IN_DATE NO_ZERO_DATE ERROR_FOR_DIVISION_BY_ZERO NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION

mysqloption.name: sql_auto_is_null
mysqloption.description: If set to 1, you can find the last inserted row for a table that contains an AUTO_INCREMENT column by using the following construct: WHERE auto_increment_column IS NULL

mysqloption.name: sql_big_selects
mysqloption.description: If set to 0, MySQL aborts SELECT statements that are likely to take a very long time to execute

mysqloption.name: sql_big_tables
mysqloption.description: This variable is deprecated, and is mapped to big_tables

mysqloption.name: sql_buffer_result
mysqloption.description: Forces the result to be put into a temporary table

mysqloption.name: sql_log_bin
mysqloption.description: Toggle binary logging

mysqloption.name: sql_log_off
mysqloption.description: If set to 1, no logging is done to the general query log for this client

mysqloption.name: sql_log_update
mysqloption.description: This variable is deprecated, and is mapped to SQL_LOG_BIN

mysqloption.name: sql_low_priority_updates
mysqloption.description: This variable is deprecated, and is mapped to low_priority_updates

mysqloption.name: sql_max_join_size
mysqloption.description: This variable is deprecated, and is mapped to max_join_size

mysqloption.name: sql_notes
mysqloption.description: If set to 1, warnings of Note level are recorded

mysqloption.name: sql_quote_show_create
mysqloption.description: If set to 1 the server quotes identifiers for SHOW CREATE TABLE and SHOW CREATE DATABASE statements

mysqloption.name: sql_safe_updates
mysqloption.description: If set to 1, MySQL aborts UPDATE or DELETE statements that do not use a key in the WHERE clause or a LIMIT clause

mysqloption.name: sql_select_limit
mysqloption.description: The maximum number of rows to return from SELECT statements

mysqloption.name: sql_slave_skip_counter
mysqloption.description: Number of events from the master that a slave server should skip. Not compatible with GTID replication.

mysqloption.name: sql_warnings
mysqloption.description: This variable controls whether single-row INSERT statements produce an information string if warnings occur

mysqloption.description: The verification mode for replication SSL connections

mysqloption.name: standalone
mysqloption.description: Instructs the MySQL server not to run as a service

mysqloption.name: storage_engine
mysqloption.description: The default storage engine

mysqloption.name: stored_program_cache
mysqloption.description: Sets a "soft" upper limit for number of cached stored routines per connection. Stored procedures and stored functions are cached separately; this variable sets size for both of these.

mysqloption.name: stored_program_definition_cache
mysqloption.description: Defines the number of stored program and event definition objects that can be kept in the dictionary object cache

mysqloption.name: super-large-pages
mysqloption.description: Enable support for super large pages

mysqloption.name: super_read_only
mysqloption.description: Whether to ignore SUPER exceptions to read-only mode

mysqloption.name: symbolic-links
mysqloption.description: Use symbolic links

mysqloption.name: sync-bdb-logs
mysqloption.description: Synchronously flush Berkeley DB logs. Enabled by default

mysqloption.name: sync_binlog
mysqloption.description: Synchronously flush binary log to disk after every #th event

mysqloption.name: sync_frm
mysqloption.description: Sync .frm to disk on create. Enabled by default

mysqloption.name: sync_master_info
mysqloption.description: Synchronize master.info to disk after every #th event.

mysqloption.name: sync_relay_log
mysqloption.description: Synchronize relay log to disk after every #th event.

mysqloption.name: sync_relay_log_info
mysqloption.description: Synchronize relay.info file to disk after every #th event.

mysqloption.name: sysdate-is-now
mysqloption.description: Nondefault option to alias SYSDATE() to NOW() to make it safe-replicable

mysqloption.name: system_time_zone
mysqloption.description: The server system time zone

mysqloption.name: tablespace_definition_cache
mysqloption.description: Defines the number of tablespace definition objects that can be kept in the dictionary object cache

mysqloption.name: table_cache
mysqloption.description: Number of open tables for all threads

mysqloption.name: table_definition_cache
mysqloption.description: Number of table definitions that can be stored in the definition cache.

mysqloption.name: table_lock_wait_timeout
mysqloption.description: Currently unused

mysqloption.description: Number of times that a table lock was acquired immediately

mysqloption.name: table_open_cache
mysqloption.description: Number of open tables for all threads

mysqloption.description: Number of hits for open tables cache lookups

mysqloption.description: Number of misses for open tables cache lookups

mysqloption.name: Tc_log_max_pages_used
mysqloption.description: When the memory-mapped implementation of the log that is used by mysqld acts as the transaction coordinator for recovery of internal XA transactions,this variable indicates the largest number of pages used for the log since the server started

mysqloption.name: Tc_log_page_size
mysqloption.description: The page size used for the memory-mapped implementation of the XA recovery log

mysqloption.name: Tc_log_page_waits
mysqloption.description: For the memory-mapped implementation of the recovery log, this variable increments each time the server was not able to commit a transaction and had to wait for a free page in the log

mysqloption.description: Using this option will cause most temporary files created to use a small set of names, rather than a unique name for each new file

mysqloption.name: thread_cache_size
mysqloption.description: How many threads we should keep in a cache for reuse

mysqloption.description: Permits the application to give the threads system a hint for the desired number of threads that should be run at the same time
